title: This is litteraly the biggest hypocrisy I have seen from Riot in my whole life

embed.description: Hi folks, We’ve just got back from the holiday break and I wanted to talk about how we see the game at present. In the next couple of weeks we’ll be putting out a longer ‘State of the Game’ post.

body:
> **We believe that the biggest priority right now is addressing jungler dominance, with junglers able to gank more often, and more successfully, than appropriate.**

Riot litteraly changed EVERYTHING in the jungle to encourage this kind of meta.

Jungle camps take longer to respawn, making it less effective to farm.

Jungle camps don't give buffs anymore, encouraging the use of smite to simply clear camps faster and then gank instead of keeping smite for a specific camp.

Krugs and Raptors take more time and health to clear, discouraging junglers from clearing them.

Buffs don't have babies anymore, making it even less rewarding to farm in the jungle.

Plants are added, giving junglers a way to litteraly see wich bushes are warded in the lane they are going to gank (Blue plants) and giving them a way to reach the lane they want to gank faster by jumping wall OR giving them escape routes that would have been impossible before (blast cone).

Gave towers a first blood, encouraging ganks bot lane since it's faster to take down a tower as 3 than as 2.

And then Meddler comes and say that the biggest problem right now is the dominance of junglers who can gank often and well? What a surprise!!! WHO COULD HAVE PREDICTED THAT :O

I am litteraly raging, it's like Riot put gas all over the place before dropping a lighter in it and then saying '' Wow the place is on fire we really need to fix this''.

EDIT: Forgot to mention how courage of the colossus makes it so much easier to gank

They handled pre-season incredibly poorly. Their first mistake was starting ranked season so soon, not allowing them to properly balance the game before it came out on a competitive level. Now everyone seems to think the game should be fair and balanced when in reality we're still technically on the preseason patch, an out of whack one with too much snowballing, even for my liking.

First and foremost, they should have under no circumstance released Camille when they did. They released a champion that is hitting 54% on release **and climbing.** This is absurd, especially considering the season just started and there's already a ban taken out of the way. 

They started the ranked season, released a brand new champion that is clearly overtuned along with a swoth of other changes then had the audacity to go on a week or two break for the holidays. Don't get me wrong, taking a break isn't bad, but releasing so much and just letting it fester in your game with no changes for so long is poor business practice and should be shunned. They didn't even have the courtesy to wait until after their break before releasing these changes and that's why the community is so pissed. 

Even Reddit, a place usually full of plays from streamers and e-sports talk is filled with gameplay threads, mostly stating ADC's are weak (not entirely true). Regardless if they are on point with the real problems, it's still astounding to see so much backlash from a place void of actual gameplay discussion.
I've got to admit waiting for them to be off break before having any changes made to balance is pretty lame, especialy in season start when most placement matches take place.

"What the fuck, why are you nerfing Exp in jungle?"

The difference with lowering EXP, is that it forces Junglers to actually farm in jungle, instead of just snowballing off lanes. They don't "Need" to gank, as their first clears aren't going to let them get to Level 3 while the laner is still level 2, meaning they're going to be in the jungle longer. If they gank, and fail the gank, then they are actually set back, as opposed to the other jungler, who could still be farming in jungle. 

It pushes the jungle back into somewhat the same idea as a laner. If you want levels, you're going to have to farm more.

Except the problem that Tidal mostly plays Gangplank, a very high octane map control champion, so taking teleport + his ult and still not resulting with a lot of impact on a carry champion says a lot about the current meta. Botlane has the largest effect, but teleporting down means if you need to rapidly apply pressure, the opponent will back off to make sure they aren't overwhelmed and play it out safely. Meanwhile, your top opponent, who may or may not be leading or losing, gets to freely waveclear because Teleporting bot means he has a free lane to CS and ensure to gain back losses or even snowball a lead. Teleport is good for going into teamfights or helping objective control is only good when it is remotely in the jungle, and they can risk the opponent backing off which means it wasn't a waste of a summoner. Into late game, teleport becomes either a heavy splitpushing tool or teleporting into a jungle zone for dragon control or preparing for a teamfight in certain lanes. Wildly teleporting to apply pressure is stupid, and overall, your comment is extremely arrogant considering we all know it is a bot lane meta where if the jungle comes and ganks, which is much harder to predict, you have overall better map coverage, and forces teleport into a summoner used to just get back to lane or help jump towards an enlongated teamfight.
